page.title: 15POPULATION
page.content: The population of Braceby and Sapperton was 64 persons at the time of the{1981 census,}comprised of 35 males and 29 females. The population was made up of 18 children aged less than 16 years, 33 adults aged 16 to 64 years, and 13 persons over the retirement age of 65 years. Declining employment in agriculture and the improvement and modernisation of many houses have been factors in bringing about significant change in the social structure of the community. In 1981 only two households in the two villages were without a car, and more than half of all households had two or more cars. The present total of 21 households in the two villages compares with a figure of 35 families at the time of Domesday 1085.
